WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: A drop of rain falls on a bear leaning up against a cross stuck into a mound. The drop wakes the bear up and he rolls down off the mound. After the bear rights himself, he assumes that the cross pushed him off the mound so he charges into the cross atop the mound and knocks it over.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Imagine this whole scene. A drop of water rouses the bear and he becomes enraged after he rolls down the mound. Hear the bear roar with anger as he charges up the mound and violently smashes the cross into the ground.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: Once the bear fully wakes up he realizes that he just rolled down the mound on his own and the cross was not to blame. What a fool (ãµ) this bear was. He knows it too. The bear feels pretty foolish.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Now look at the bear sitting atop the mound with his head in his paws, looking like a fool filled with regret. This bear feels like a fool for attacking the cross like he did.

humanum_full_description_en:
The shape of an oracle bone inscription ladder (Xu Zhongshu, Xu Jinxiong). One said that Xiangtu Mountain is high and steep, and its hillside has steps (Ye Yusen). The original meaning is ladder, and it is extended to mountain and highland. Wang Yun's "Shuowen Shirui": "The paintings are like Pituo, and the layers are heavy." In addition to being an independent character, " Fu " is also an important part of Chinese characters. From radical " Fu " word, such as " order ", " except ", " Pi ", " Deng ", " terrace ", " throne " has a sense of class; " Zhi ", " down ", " L " " rainbow ", " meteorite ", " fall ", " fall ", " Duo ", " ruin " are on the increase or decrease fall of righteousness; " frontier ", " Jun ", " dangerous ", " Wu ", " steep " Qui " has the meaning of high or dangerous (Xu Zhongshu). " Bei ", " Tuo ", " Tomb ", "é˜¤" and so on have the meaning of hill or hillside. "Said Wen": "ğ¨¸ (fu), there is no stone in the mainland mountain. Pictogram. All the genus of ğ¨¸ is from ğ¨¸. ğ ¼›, ancient Chinese."

The original meaning of " fu " has three sayings: First, I think there is a Han class (Ye Yusen) in the Xiangtu Mountain. Second, I think that "the picturesque Potuo are tired from each other" (Wang Yun). Third, it looks like a trapezoid (Wang Guowei, Xu Jinxiong). The ancients often lived in caves and chose places with high soil layers, and they had to climb steps to go home. Therefore, the " fu " is like a trapezoid (Xu Zhongshu). All the above said that the step is the original meaning of the word " fu ". As for the interpretation of " fu " as a high ground , As the extended meaning. In addition, "Er Ya. "Shidi": "Gaoping called land, mainland called Fu, and Dafu called Mausoleum." "Mainland" refers to high and flat earth mountains in ancient times. Therefore, the word " fu " was extended to mean vast and rich. For example, "Fufu Minfeng" means rich products and happiness for the people.

Oracle is used as the name of person and place. It may also refer to the high ground. "Compilation" 10405 is: "Cai (åœ¨)[å®€ğ¦”»] (åº­) Fu", " Ting " is the name of a place, which refers to the steep place in the court.
humanum_short_description_en: Oracle elephant ladder. One is like a high earth mountain with steps on its slopes. Therefore, " fu " can refer to steps, mountains, and highlands.

Radicals: ä¸¶, å  (drop, cross, bear)
Meaning Mnemonic
A drop of rain falls on a bear leaning up against a cross stuck into a mound. The drop wakes the bear up and he rolls down off the mound. After the bear rights himself, he assumes that the cross pushed him off the mound so he charges into the cross atop the mound and knocks it over.
Imagine this whole scene. A drop of water rouses the bear and he becomes enraged after he rolls down the mound. Hear the bear roar with anger as he charges up the mound and violently smashes the cross into the ground.
Reading Mnemonic
Once the bear fully wakes up he realizes that he just rolled down the mound on his own and the cross was not to blame. What a fool (ãµ) this bear was. He knows it too. The bear feels pretty foolish.
Now look at the bear sitting atop the mound with his head in his paws, looking like a fool filled with regret. This bear feels like a fool for attacking the cross like he did.
